subtopics.title: Understanding Measurement: The Language of Size! ğŸ“Š
subtopics.content:
**Simple Explanation:** Mensuration is the art of measuring! Perimeter tells us "how much fence we need," Area tells us "how much carpet we need," and Volume (later) tells us "how much water fits inside!"

**Memory Aid:** "**P**erimeter **P**rotects the **P**erimeter, **A**rea **A**dorns the **A**rea!" ğŸ¡

**The Three Measurement Types:**
1. **Perimeter:** Boundary length (fence, border)
2. **Area:** Surface coverage (carpet, paint)
3. **Volume:** Space inside (water, air) - coming later!

**Visual Story:** Imagine your room:
- Walk around edges = Perimeter
- Paint the floor = Area
- Fill with balloons = Volume

**Real-World Examples:**
- Garden: Fence (P), Lawn (A), Soil (V)
- Room: Baseboard (P), Carpet (A), Air (V)
- Book: Cover border (P), Page (A), Pages thickness (V)

subtopics.title: Understanding Height vs Side in Triangles
subtopics.content:
**Height:** Perpendicular distance from base to opposite vertex

**Base:** Any side can be base!

**Important Rule:** Height MUST be perpendicular to base!

**Visual Examples:**
```

```

subtopics.title: Perimeter vs Area: Key Differences
subtopics.content:
**Comparison Table:**
```

Meaning:   Boundary length       Surface covered
Units:     Linear (cm, m)       Square (cmÂ², mÂ²)
Use:       Fencing, border      Carpeting, painting
Formula:   Add all sides        Multiply dimensions
Visual:    Walk around edge     Fill inside space

Example: Rectangle 6cm Ã— 4cm
Perimeter: 6+4+6+4 = 20cm
Area: 6Ã—4 = 24cmÂ²
```

**Interactive Activity:** "Same but Different"

1. Same area, different perimeter

**Discovery:**
- Area can be same while perimeter changes
- Perimeter can be same while area changes

**Real-World Understanding:**

- Room border â‰  Floor space

**Definition:** Total area of all faces of 3D shape

**Formula:** SA = 2(lb + bh + hl)

**Why this formula?**

- 2 faces: l Ã— b (top & bottom)
- 2 faces: b Ã— h (front & back)
- 2 faces: h Ã— l (sides)
Total = 2lb + 2bh + 2hl = 2(lb + bh + hl)

**Memory Aid:** "**S**urface **A**rea = **S**um **A**ll **S**ides!"

**Surface Area of Cube:**
**Formula:** SA = 6 Ã— SideÂ²

subtopics.title: Area of Polygon: The Triangle Division! ğŸ”º
subtopics.content:
**Regular Polygon Method:**
1. Divide into n congruent triangles
2. Each triangle: base = side, height = apothem
3. Area = n Ã— (Â½ Ã— side Ã— apothem)
   = Â½ Ã— Perimeter Ã— Apothem

**Irregular Polygon Method:**
1. Divide into triangles and quadrilaterals
2. Calculate each area
3. Sum all areas

**Key Terms:**
- **Apothem:** Perpendicular from center to side
- **Center:** Equal distance from all vertices (regular)
- **Perimeter:** Sum of all sides

**Example:** Hexagon (6 sides) with side 5cm, apothem 4.33cm
Perimeter = 6 Ã— 5 = 30cm
Area = Â½ Ã— 30 Ã— 4.33 = 64.95cmÂ²

**Memory Aid:** "**P**olygon **A**rea = **H**alf **P**erimeter Ã— **A**pothem!"

**Memory Aid:** "**H**eron helps when **H**eights hidden!"

**Step-by-Step Example:** Triangle sides 13cm, 14cm, 15cm
1. Calculate s = (13+14+15)/2 = 21cm
2. s-a = 21-13 = 8
   s-b = 21-14 = 7
   s-c = 21-15 = 6
3. s(s-a)(s-b)(s-c) = 21Ã—8Ã—7Ã—6 = 7056
4. Area = âˆš7056 = 84cmÂ²

**Verification:** Can check with base-height method if possible

- Heat loss minimization
- Chemical reaction optimization

**Example Comparison:**

- Sphere: r = âˆ›(3V/4Ï€) â‰ˆ 6.2cm, SA â‰ˆ 483 cmÂ²
